Datastructures.Theory

Class ImplicationDAG

  • java.lang.Object
    • Datastructures.Theory.ImplicationDAG

  • public class ImplicationDAG
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents propositional logic ID_Implications 'p -> q' as a DAG (directed acyclic graph). For an implication 'p -> q' the converse '-q -> -q' is also automatically inserted. The DAG avoids cycles and inconsistencies. For example, 'p -> q' and '-p -> q' yields 'q' as a new derived literal.
    The methods are synchronised with read-write locks. Created by ohlbach on 26.09.2018.

      • addClause

        public void addClause(java.lang.Integer literal1,
                      java.lang.Integer literal2)
        adds a clause to the DAG. For a clause p,q the two ID_Implications '-p -> q' and '-q -> p' are added.
        Parameters:
        literal1 - a literal
        literal2 - a literal

      • addImplication

        public boolean addImplication(java.lang.Integer from,
                              java.lang.Integer to)
        adds a single implication 'p -> q' to the DAG
        Parameters:
        from - the antecedent
        to - the succedent
        Returns:
        true if the implication was not added (because it was already there, or a contradiction or a cycle was generated.

        Parameters:

        equivalences - the list of equivalent literals (without the representative)

                            java.util.TreeSet<ImplicationNode> equivalences)

        Parameters:

        downNode - the lower entrance to the cycle
        equivalences - the list of equivalent nodes

      • mergeEquivalences

        private void mergeEquivalences(ImplicationNode upNode,
                               java.util.TreeSet<ImplicationNode> equivalences)
        collects all edges into the cycle and the edges out of the cycle and attaches them to the representative of the equivalence class.
        Parameters:
        upNode - the representative of the equivalence class
        equivalences - the other nodes of the equivalence class

        public void apply(java.lang.Integer literal,

                  java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Integer> consumer)
        applies the consumer to all nodes below/above the given literal
        Parameters:
        literal - a literal
        down - if true then the consumer is applied to all implied literals, otherwise to all literals which imply 'this'
        consumer - a consumer function to be applied to literals

        Parameters:
        falseLiteral - a literal

      • completeModel

        public void completeModel(Model model)
        completes the model such that all ID_Implications in the DAG become true. Not all literals need to be assigned truth values. It is, however, not clear whether the model is minimal. The DAG becomes empty by this operation. The trueLiteralObservers are overwritten.
        Parameters:
        model - a partial model.

      • reportTrueLiteral

        private void reportTrueLiteral(java.lang.Integer trueLiteral)
        calls all trueLiteralObservers
        Parameters:
        trueLiteral - a true literal

      • reportImplication

        private void reportImplication(java.lang.Integer from,
                               java.lang.Integer to)
        calls all implicationObservers
        Parameters:
        from - a literal
        to - a literal

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        turns the entire DAG into a String
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the DAG as a String

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(Symboltable symboltable)
        turns the entire DAG into a string. The literal names are used instead of the numbers
        Parameters:
        symboltable - mapping literal numbers to literal names.
        Returns:
        the entire DAG as a String.
